inputs.task: Design and improve the LaunchBase homepage from first principles
inputs.whitePaper:
LaunchBase is an operating system for small businesses.
Not a website builder. Not another tool. Not a one-time agency project.

LaunchBase is ongoing ownership of a business's digital operating layer:
- website uptime + maintenance
- lead capture + forms
- monitoring + safety decisions
- updates + publishing cadence
- integrations + visibility
- logging + accountability

LaunchBase exists because most small businesses already have tools, but no one owns the system.
They have a website, a payment tool, a calendar, a Google profile, and logins…
…but the owner still carries the burden of making sure everything works.

LaunchBase sells relief from that cognitive load.

Core customer pain: The customer isn't buying a website. They're buying the ability to stop thinking about:
- "Is it still working?"
- "Did that form actually send?"
- "What should I post?"
- "Is anything broken?"
- "Am I missing something?"

This is background anxiety, not a feature gap.
The enemy is not "lack of tools."
The enemy is lack of ownership.

LaunchBase replaces the customer as the default system-checker.

Promise:
✅ Change is reversible
✅ Non-action is safe
✅ Silence is a valid decision
✅ Every action is logged
✅ Customer sees their real site before paying
✅ LaunchBase acts only after approval

The brand is accountability.
LaunchBase is responsibility-as-a-service.

Target customer:
- owner-operator
- service business
- small team
- not "tech obsessed"
- wants a business to run, not to "manage tools"

Tone: calm, competent, honest, operationally serious, safety-first, premium but not flashy.
This is a systems product, not a "creative brand party."

Design objective:
✅ Create instant trust
✅ Communicate the contract clearly
✅ Show the "safe-by-default" nature
✅ Make "Hand It Off" feel low-risk
✅ Explain observability in plain English
✅ Look premium enough to justify recurring ownership

currentCopy.hero: Stop carrying the system in your head. Hand it off. Keep visibility.
currentCopy.problem: No one owns the system. You're the fallback for everything.
currentCopy.solution: LaunchBase becomes the owner. You stay informed, not involved.
currentCopy.trust: Safe by default. Fully logged. Reversible.

inputs.audience: Owner-operators of service businesses (fitness studios, coffee shops, consulting firms) who want stability and accountability, not tool management
inputs.tone: Calm, minimal, trustworthy, premium. Avoid hype. Avoid 'AI magic.' Avoid exaggerated claims.
inputs.constraints: Mobile-first. Must feel like 'responsibility-as-a-service.' Must emphasize safety, reversibility, observability. Must reduce mental load while reading.

proposedChanges.value: Add a clear CTA button beneath the hero headline that says 'See How It Works' to direct users immediately to the explanatory content.
proposedChanges.rationale: A clear CTA in the hero section will guide users to engage with the content immediately, reducing hesitation and cognitive load.
risks: May distract from the hero message

proposedChanges.value: Merge 'Problem' and 'Solution' into a single section with a two-column layout: problems on the left and solutions on the right.
proposedChanges.rationale: This layout allows users to quickly correlate problems with solutions, improving scannability and comprehension.
risks: May reduce emphasis on individual points

proposedChanges.value: Add an interactive timeline or visual flowchart to illustrate the process of handing off responsibilities to LaunchBase.
proposedChanges.rationale: Visual aids can enhance understanding of complex processes, reducing cognitive load and increasing engagement.

proposedChanges.value: Convert pricing tables to cards with one highlighted default tier; add 'what you get' bullets under each tier for clarity.
proposedChanges.rationale: Cards with bullet points make pricing information easier to compare and understand, aiding decision-making.

proposedChanges.value: Add a sticky primary CTA on mobile after 40% scroll; keep secondary CTA in hero only.
proposedChanges.rationale: A sticky CTA ensures users always have the option to take action without scrolling back, enhancing conversion opportunities.
risks: May feel intrusive if not designed subtly

proposedChanges.value: Integrate a trust band with logos of known partners or testimonials between 'How It Works' and 'Pricing' sections.
proposedChanges.rationale: Building trust with recognizable logos or testimonials before showing pricing can increase user confidence in the service.
risks: Requires up-to-date and relevant partner logos/testimonials

proposedChanges.value: Ensure all sections are collapsible on mobile to reduce scrolling and allow users to focus on one section at a time.
proposedChanges.rationale: Collapsible sections enhance usability on mobile by reducing cognitive load and making navigation more manageable.
risks: Important information might be overlooked if collapsed by default

proposedChanges.value: Use 48px H1 (mobile: 32px) with line-height 1.1 for hero headline to create calm, confident tone
proposedChanges.rationale: A larger headline with appropriate line-height establishes a sense of calm and confidence, aligning with the brand's tone of being operationally serious.
risks: May require more vertical space, potentially affecting mobile layout.

proposedChanges.rationale: Generous spacing between sections will help create a calm and orderly layout, reducing mental load while reading.
risks: Could lead to increased scrolling, which might affect user engagement.

proposedChanges.value: Use pill-shaped buttons with 16px padding, subtle shadow, no gradients
proposedChanges.rationale: Pill-shaped buttons with subtle shadows appear premium and approachable, aligning with the brand's tone of being trustworthy and premium.
risks: Might blend with the background if not enough contrast is provided.

proposedChanges.value: Add 3-chip row below hero: 'Safe by default • Fully auditable • Reversible changes'
proposedChanges.rationale: Highlighting key trust elements in a chip format immediately communicates safety and accountability, reinforcing the brand's promise.
risks: May be overlooked if not visually distinct enough from other elements.

proposedChanges.value: Set max text width to 65ch for body copy to improve readability
proposedChanges.rationale: Limiting the line length enhances readability and helps maintain user focus, creating a calm reading experience.
risks: May require adjustments to layout to accommodate shorter lines.

proposedChanges.value: Use card style with subtle border and 24px padding for audit log preview
proposedChanges.rationale: A subtle bordered card with ample padding enhances clarity and organization, aligning with the brand's operationally serious tone.
risks: May impact visual hierarchy if not distinct enough from other elements.

proposedChanges.value: Incorporate proof chips with concise audit log details beside main content
proposedChanges.rationale: Providing immediate access to audit logs builds trust by showcasing transparency and accountability.
risks: May clutter the interface if not designed with sufficient whitespace.

proposedChanges.value: Ensure all text and interactive elements meet WCAG AA contrast standards
proposedChanges.rationale: High contrast improves readability and accessibility, ensuring the platform is safe and inclusive for all users.
risks: May limit color palette choices, impacting aesthetic flexibility.

assumptions: Current copy accurately reflects the service capabilities described in the white paper

swarm.reason: Missing craft or critic artifact for collapse
